Name: ETHNIC GROUP MEMBERSHIP
Subconcepts (comma-separated): LFHC:901, LFHC:902, LFHC:903, LFHC:904, LFHC:905, LFHC:906, LFHC:907, LFHC:908, LFHC:909, LFHC:910, LFHC:911

Name: MAIN LANGUAGE SPOKEN
Subconcepts (comma-separated): LFHC:913, LFHC:914, LFHC:915, LFHC:916, LFHC:917, LFHC:918, LFHC:919

Name: WOUND DRAINAGE
Synonyms (comma-separated): incision drainage, fluid from incision, fluid from wound, surgical site drainage
Description: What is the fluid draining from a wound or surgical site - could be from surgical incision or injury site

Name: PLEURAL FLUID DRAINAGE
Synonyms (comma-separated): chest tube drainage, pleural fluid, chest drainage, empyema drainage
Description: what is the amount of fluid draining through a hole in the chest wall from the pleural cavity through a chest tube or an incision

Name: Beriberi risk
Synonyms (comma-separated): risk of thiamine deficiency,vitamin B1 deficiency risk
Description: Is this an infant who has the following risk factors which may lead to a deficiency of thiamine and necessitates possible treatment with thiamine rapidly: maternal food taboos, maternal symptoms of leg numbness or weakness,1-6 months old, poor feeding, vomiting, irritability, weight loss, hoarseness, fast heart rate, edema, hepatomegaly?

Name: Hourly Intravenous fluids
Description: amount of IV fluids given in that hour

Name: Hourly oral intake
Description: amount of oral fluids given in that hour

Name: Other hourly intake
Description: amount of other fluids given in that hour including NG

Name: ultrasound of appendix
Description: test done to check for appendicitis

Name: Musculoskeletal system and injury diagnosis
Description: any injury that can occur in musculoskeletal system

Name: other x-ray
Description: text description of other x-ray required

Name: x-ray order
Description: set to link x-ray order and results and other comments

Name: ultrasound results comments
Description: text box to write result comments

Name: Ultrasound order
Description: set to link ultrasound order and results and other comments

Name: maternal medication use
Synonyms (comma-separated): prenatal drugs, pregnancy drugs, gestational drugs, maternal use of medications - need to space for 4 drugs
Description: these are medications used by the biological mother of the child during her pregnancy or while breastfeeding

Name: medication list
Description: common drugs in opd and ipd

Name: head bobbing
Description: movements of infant head with respiratory distress

Name: receiving oxygen therapy
Description: is the patient receiving oxygen therapy

Name: oxygen therapy in litres
Description: How much oxygen is the patient receiving?

Name: drug route
Description: what drug route should be used?

Name: factors affecting wound healing
Description: what factors are affecting the healing of this wound?

Name: measurement across wound in cm
Description: Measurements Greatest width across wound in cm

Name: exudate present on wound
Description: is there exudate on the wound?

Name: type of exudate
Description: what type of exudate is present?

Name: surrounding skin temperature
Description: what is the surrounding skin temperature?

Name: Odour
Description: Is there an odour present in the wound

Name: skin condition
Description: what is the colour/condition of the skin

Name: Dressing Change Frequency
Description: how frequently do you need to change the dressing

Name: Analgesia Required
Description: Is pain treatment or analgesia required during the procedure?

Name: Referral Site
Description: where was the patient referred from?

Name: Fasting (nothing by mouth)
Description: patient should not be eating or drinking

Name: Diet
Description: what should the patient be eating?

Name: Acute airway obstruction
Description: Does the patient have any airway problems?

Name: Emergency Triage
Description: does the patient have any emergency symptoms that require emergency triage?

Name: Priority Triage
Description: does the patient have any emergency symptoms that require emergency triage?

Name: tiny baby
Description: child less than 2 months of age

Name: when necessary
Description: frequency is at the patients choice

Name: iv fluid type
Description: what type of iv fluid is required by the patient?

Name: IV orders
Description: type and rate of iv fluid

Name: patient bracelet
Description: does the patient have an id bracelet in place?

Name: Family aware of plan/ reason for admission
Urinary catheter date
Description: date of insertion of urinary catheter

Name: Follow up appointments made if needed
Description: Follow up appointments made if needed

Name: Discharge CheckList
Subconcepts (comma-separated): LFHC:1091, LFHC:1092, LFHC:1093, LFHC:1094, LFHC:1095, LFHC:1096

Name: Discharged to:
Description: where was the patient discharged to

Name: Condition at Discharge
Description: what was the condition of the patient at discharge

Name: pain in limb (amount)
Description: amount of pain in limb out of 10

Name: extremity pulse
Description: quality of pulse in affected limb

Name: Movement of affected extremity
Description: how well does the extremity move?

Name: Sensation of Affected Extremity
Description: what is the sensation of the affected extremity

Name: Swelling of affected extremity
Description: is swelling present in the affected extremity

Name: admission unit
Description: what unit is the patient admitted to?

Name: Oxygen saturation goal
Description: what is the goal for oxygen saturation

Name: x-ray results
Description: Question to provide x-ray tests results (likely to be used in a set)

Description: Question to provide ultrasound tests results (likely to be used in a set)
